intro: Nidorella longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved nidorella, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Nidorella longifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
